description: A classic Italian pizza with tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 475°F with pizza stone inside.
Roll out pizza dough into a 12-inch circle.
Crush tomatoes and mix with minced garlic, salt, and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough, leaving 1-inch border.
Tear mozzarella and distribute over sauce.
Drizzle with remaining olive oil.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbles.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves.
Let cool for 2 minutes, slice and serve.

description: Slow-cooked pork shoulder with a smoky BBQ rub.
instructions:
Mix brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, salt, and cayenne to create dry rub.
Massage rub all over pork shoulder, ensuring complete coverage.
Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Preheat smoker or oven to 225°F.
Place pork in smoker fat-side up.
Smoke for 8 hours, spraying with apple cider vinegar every hour after the first 2 hours.
When internal temperature reaches 195°F, remove and wrap in foil.
Let rest for 30 minutes.
Shred pork using two forks, discarding excess fat.
Mix shredded pork with BBQ sauce and serve on buns.

description: A healthy grain bowl with quinoa, sweet potatoes, chickpeas, and kale.
instructions:
Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Toss sweet potato cubes with 1 tbsp olive oil, cumin, salt and pepper.
Roast sweet potato at 400°F for 20 minutes.
Drain and rinse chickpeas, then roast alongside sweet potato.
Massage kale with remaining olive oil until softened.
Whisk tahini with lemon juice and water to create dressing.
Divide quinoa between two bowls.
Top with roasted sweet potato, chickpeas, and kale.
Slice avocado and arrange on top.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.

description: Layered pasta with beef, ricotta, mozzarella, and marinara sauce.
instructions:
Brown ground beef with minced garlic in a large pan.
Add marinara sauce to beef and simmer for 15 minutes.
Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions.
Mix ricotta, egg, half the parmesan, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Spread thin layer of meat sauce in 9x13 inch baking dish.
Layer: noodles, ricotta mixture, meat sauce, mozzarella.
Repeat layers twice more.
Top final layer with remaining mozzarella and parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.
Remove foil, bake 15 more minutes until bubbly.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

description: A fragrant Thai curry with chicken, coconut milk, and vegetables.
instructions:
Heat 3 tbsp coconut milk in wok over medium-high heat.
Add green curry paste and fry for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.
Pour in remaining coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add bamboo shoots, sliced bell pepper, and green beans.
Stir in fish sauce and palm sugar.
Simmer for 15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Tear Thai basil and stir through curry.
Squeeze lime juice over curry.
Serve with jasmine rice.

description: A fresh Greek salad topped with grilled chicken breast.
instructions:
Season chicken breasts with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion in large bowl.
Add olives and crumbled feta cheese.
Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and remaining oregano for dressing.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Top salad with sliced grilled chicken.
Serve immediately.

description: Rich chocolate cakes with a gooey molten center.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Butter four ramekins and dust with cocoa powder.
Melt chocolate and butter together in double boiler.
In separate bowl, whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until thick.
Fold melted chocolate into egg mixture.
Sift flour and salt into mixture, fold gently.
Divide batter evenly among ramekins.
Bake for 12 minutes until edges are firm but center jiggles.
Let cool for 1 minute.
Invert onto plates and serve immediately with ice cream.

description: A fresh poke bowl with marinated salmon and vegetables.
instructions:
Cook sushi rice according to package instructions.
Cube salmon into bite-sized pieces.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar.
Marinate salmon in sauce for 10 minutes.
Season cooked rice with rice vinegar.
Divide rice between two bowls.
Arrange marinated salmon on one side of bowl.
Add avocado slices, cucumber, edamame, and seaweed salad.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
Drizzle with remaining marinade and serve.

recipe_name: Beef Tacos with Pico de Gallo
description: Seasoned beef tacos topped with fresh pico de gallo.
instructions:
Brown ground beef in skillet over medium-high heat.
Add cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to beef.
Cook for 8-10 minutes until fully cooked.
Mix tomatoes, half the onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and juice of 1 lime for pico.
Season pico de gallo with salt.
Warm tortillas in dry skillet for 30 seconds each side.
Fill tortillas with seasoned beef.
Top with pico de gallo and shredded lettuce.
Add dollop of sour cream.
Serve with lime wedges.

description: Creamy risotto with mixed mushrooms and parmesan.
instructions:
Keep vegetable stock warm in a separate pot.
Sauté mushrooms in 1 tbsp butter until golden, set aside.
In large pan, melt remaining butter and sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and rice, toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Wait until each addition is absorbed before adding more.
Continue for 20-25 minutes until rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in cooked mushrooms, parmesan, and thyme.
Season with salt and pepper, serve immediately.

description: A quick chicken stir-fry with mixed vegetables in a savory soy and oyster sauce.
instructions:
Mix chicken with 1 tbsp soy sauce and cornstarch, marinate 10 minutes.
Heat oil in wok over high heat.
Stir-fry chicken until cooked through, remove and set aside.
Add more oil if needed, stir-fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli and carrot, stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add bell peppers, stir-fry for 2 more minutes.
Return chicken to wok.
Add remaining soy sauce and oyster sauce.
Toss everything together for 2 minutes.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve over rice.

description: Fluffy pancakes filled with fresh blueberries and served with butter and maple syrup.
instructions:
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in large bowl.
In separate bowl, whisk milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry and mix until just combined.
Fold in blueberries gently.
Heat griddle or pan over medium heat, add butter.
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on surface, about 3 minutes.
Flip and cook another 2-3 minutes until golden.
Keep warm in oven while cooking remaining pancakes.
Serve stacked with butter and maple syrup.

description: A warming Moroccan-style stew with chickpeas, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, and spices.
instructions:
Heat oil in large pot, sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and spices, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add sweet potato cubes, stir to coat with spices.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth.
Add chickpeas and bring to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir occasionally until sweet potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve with lemon wedges and couscous.

description: Linguine tossed with garlicky butter shrimp, lemon, and white wine sauce.
instructions:
Cook linguine according to package directions, reserve 1 cup pasta water.
Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and half the butter in large skillet.
Add shrimp and cook 2 minutes per side until pink, remove.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté 1 minute.
Pour in white wine and lemon juice, simmer 2 minutes.
Add remaining butter and lemon zest.
Return shrimp to pan.
Add drained pasta and toss, adding pasta water if needed.
Garnish with parsley and parmesan, serve immediately.

description: A Korean mixed rice bowl with beef, vegetables, fried egg, and spicy gochujang.
instructions:
Cook rice according to package instructions.
Blanch spinach for 1 minute, squeeze dry, season with sesame oil and soy sauce.
Blanch bean sprouts for 2 minutes, season similarly.
Sauté carrots until tender.
Cook beef bulgogi in hot pan until caramelized.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Divide rice among four bowls.
Arrange vegetables and beef in sections on top of rice.
Top each bowl with fried egg.
Add dollop of gochujang, sprinkle with sesame seeds and torn nori.

description: Classic Caesar salad with romaine, parmesan, croutons, and a rich homemade dressing.
instructions:
For dressing: blend anchovies, garlic, egg yolks, lemon juice, and mustard.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while blending until emulsified.
Add Worcestershire sauce and pepper to taste.
Chop romaine into bite-sized pieces.
Toss romaine with dressing until well coated.
Add croutons and half the parmesan.
Toss again gently.
Divide among plates.
Top with remaining shaved parmesan.
Add extra black pepper and serve immediately.

description: A vegetarian version of Pad Thai with tofu, eggs, noodles, and tangy tamarind sauce.
instructions:
Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes, drain.
Mix tamarind paste, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice for sauce.
Heat oil in wok, fry tofu until golden, set aside.
Scramble eggs in wok, breaking into small pieces.
Add noodles and sauce, toss for 2 minutes.
Add tofu back to wok.
Add bean sprouts and sliced green onions.
Toss everything together for 2 more minutes.
Serve topped with crushed peanuts and cilantro.
Garnish with lime wedges.

description: Baked macaroni and cheese with a creamy cheddar and gruyere sauce.
instructions:
Cook macaroni until al dente, drain and set aside.
In large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes to make roux.
Gradually whisk in milk and cream.
Cook, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens.
Remove from heat, add mustard powder, salt, and pepper.
Stir in cheddar and gruyere until melted and smooth.
Fold in cooked macaroni.
Transfer to baking dish, top with breadcrumbs and paprika.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes until golden and bubbly.

description: Comforting red lentil soup with vegetables, tomatoes, and warm spices.
instructions:
Heat olive oil in large pot, sauté onion until soft.
Add carrots and celery, cook for 5 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, and turmeric, cook 1 minute.
Rinse lentils and add to pot.
Pour in vegetable broth and crushed tomatoes.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer.
Cook for 30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Use immersion blender to partially blend for creamy texture.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

description: Salmon glazed with teriyaki sauce, served with broccoli.
instructions:
Whisk soy sauce, mirin, sake, and brown sugar to make teriyaki sauce.
Place salmon fillets in shallow dish and pour over half the sauce, marinate 10–15 minutes.
Steam or blanch broccoli until crisp-tender.
Heat pan and sear salmon skin-side down until almost cooked through.
Pour remaining sauce into pan and let it thicken slightly, spooning over salmon.
Add broccoli to pan and toss in sauce briefly.
Serve salmon and broccoli with extra sauce drizzled on top.

description: A bright and comforting Greek soup with chicken, rice, lemon, and herbs.
instructions:
Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in broth and rice, simmer 20 minutes.
Whisk eggs with lemon juice in a bowl.
Slowly add hot broth to temper egg mixture.
Pour tempered mixture back into pot.
Season with dill, salt, and pepper.
Serve warm with lemon wedges.

description: A creamy and aromatic paneer curry cooked in spiced tomato-butter sauce.
instructions:
Sauté onions in butter until golden.
Add ginger, garlic, and spices, cook 1 minute.
Stir in tomato puree and simmer 10 minutes.
Blend sauce until smooth.
Return to pan and add cream and paneer.
Simmer 5 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

description: Seasoned beef kofta served over rice with fresh vegetables and yogurt sauce.
instructions:
Mix ground beef with onion, parsley, garlic, and spices.
Shape into kofta logs.
Grill or pan-sear until browned.
Serve over rice with tomatoes, cucumber, and yogurt sauce.
Garnish with mint and sumac.

description: A creamy, spicy pasta inspired by Mexican elote with corn, cotija, and lime.
instructions:
Cook pasta until al dente.
Sauté corn in butter until lightly charred.
Stir in garlic, chili powder, and lime juice.
Mix with pasta, mayo, cotija cheese, and cilantro.
Serve with extra lime and chili.

description: A classic tapas dish featuring shrimp sautéed in garlic, olive oil, and paprika.
instructions:
Heat olive oil in skillet.
Add sliced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add shrimp and paprika.
Cook 3–4 minutes until pink.
Finish with lemon juice and parsley.
Serve with crusty bread.

description: Spicy jerk-seasoned chicken served with coconut rice and pineapple salsa.
instructions:
Coat chicken in jerk seasoning and marinate.
Grill until charred.
Cook rice in coconut milk.
Mix pineapple, red onion, lime, and cilantro for salsa.
Serve chicken over rice topped with salsa.

description: Rice noodles tossed in creamy coconut curry sauce with vegetables.
instructions:
Cook rice noodles and set aside.
Sauté vegetables in oil.
Add curry paste and fry 1 minute.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer.
Toss noodles in sauce.
Garnish with basil and lime.

description: A refreshing couscous salad with spices, vegetables, chickpeas, and herbs.
instructions:
Prepare couscous with boiling water.
Fluff and cool.
Mix with chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, and herbs.
Whisk dressing of lemon, olive oil, cumin, and paprika.
Toss and serve chilled.

description: Thin-sliced pork marinated in a spicy gochujang sauce and stir-fried.
instructions:
Mix gochujang, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and sesame oil.
Coat pork slices and marinate 30 minutes.
Stir-fry on high heat until caramelized.
Serve with rice and lettuce leaves.

description: A rustic stew with white beans, tomatoes, herbs, and vegetables.
instructions:
Sauté onion, carrot, and celery.
Add garlic and herbs.
Stir in tomatoes and broth.
Add beans and simmer 20 minutes.
Finish with olive oil and parmesan.
Serve warm with bread.

description: Fragrant stir-fried chicken infused with lemongrass, garlic, and chili.
instructions:
Marinate chicken in lemongrass, garlic, fish sauce, and sugar.
Heat oil in skillet and sear chicken.
Add chilies and onions.
Cook until caramelized.
Serve with jasmine rice and lime.

description: Soft red lentil and bulgur patties seasoned with herbs and spices.
instructions:
Boil lentils until soft.
Stir in fine bulgur and let absorb.
Sauté onion and tomato paste.
Combine all ingredients with spices.
Shape into small patties and serve with lettuce.

description: A rich and hearty black bean stew inspired by Brazilian feijoada.
instructions:
Sauté onion and garlic.
Add sausage and sear.
Stir in black beans, broth, and bay leaves.
Simmer until thick.
Serve with rice, orange slices, and cilantro.

description: A layered vegetable dish of tomatoes, eggplant, and zucchini baked in herbs.
instructions:
Slice all vegetables thinly.
Spread tomato sauce on baking dish.
Layer vegetables in alternating pattern.
Brush with olive oil and herbs.
Bake until tender and caramelized.

description: Slow-cooked chicken with apricots, spices, and almonds.
instructions:
Brown chicken in oil.
Add onions and spices.
Stir in broth and apricots.
Simmer covered until tender.
Garnish with almonds and cilantro.

description: Classic Swedish beef and pork meatballs served with creamy gravy.
instructions:
Mix meats with breadcrumbs, egg, and spices.
Form meatballs and sear.
Make gravy with butter, flour, broth, and cream.
Simmer meatballs in gravy.
Serve with mashed potatoes.

description: Sweet and savory fried rice with pineapple, ham, and vegetables.
instructions:
Heat oil in wok.
Add ham and sauté.
Stir in vegetables and pineapple.
Add cooked rice and soy sauce.
Toss until heated through.
Garnish with green onions.

description: A fluffy baked egg dish packed with fresh herbs and spices.
instructions:
Mix herbs with eggs and spices.
Heat oil in pan.
Pour mixture and cook until edges set.
Bake until firm.
Serve warm or cold.

description: Creamy potato soup with bacon, leeks, and vegetables.
instructions:
Cook bacon until crisp.
Add leeks and sauté.
Stir in potatoes, carrots, celery, and broth.
Simmer until soft.
Blend partially for creamy texture.
Season and serve.

description: Grilled steak served with fresh herby chimichurri sauce.
instructions:
Season steak with salt and pepper.
Heat grill and cook to desired doneness.
Blend parsley, garlic, vinegar, oil, and chili for chimichurri.
Rest steak, slice, and spoon sauce over top.

description: A spicy Ethiopian stew made with red lentils and berbere seasoning.
instructions:
Sauté onions in oil until caramelized.
Add garlic, ginger, and berbere.
Stir in lentils and broth.
Simmer until thick.
Serve with injera or rice.

description: Tender roasted eggplant brushed with a savory miso glaze.
instructions:
Halve eggplants and score flesh.
Roast until soft.
Whisk miso, mirin, sugar, and soy sauce.
Brush glaze and broil until caramelized.
Top with sesame seeds.

description: A hearty stew made with beef, root vegetables, and Guinness stout.
instructions:
Brown beef in oil.
Add onions and carrots.
Pour in Guinness and broth.
Add herbs and potatoes.
Simmer until beef is tender.
Serve with bread.

description: Chicken braised in a tangy, savory mixture of soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic.
instructions:
Combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, peppercorns, and bay leaves.
Add chicken and marinate.
Simmer until tender.
Reduce sauce until thickened.
Serve with rice.

description: Slow-roasted pork marinated in citrus, garlic, and oregano.
instructions:
Blend citrus juices, garlic, oregano, and oil.
Marinate pork overnight.
Roast until tender.
Shred and serve with rice or sandwiches.

description: Savory stir-fried beef with garlic, chilies, and fresh basil.
instructions:
Sauté garlic and chilies.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Stir in soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar.
Add basil and wilt.
Serve over jasmine rice.

description: A rich and creamy mushroom soup flavored with paprika and dill.
instructions:
Sauté onions and mushrooms.
Add paprika and broth.
Simmer until tender.
Stir in sour cream and dill.
Serve warm.

description: Fiery stir-fried noodles with shrimp, vegetables, and chili garlic sauce.
instructions:
Cook noodles and set aside.
Stir-fry garlic, chili paste, and shrimp.
Add vegetables.
Toss noodles with soy sauce and sugar.
Cook until combined.

description: A fragrant tomato-based soup with lentils, chickpeas, and warming spices.
instructions:
Sauté onion and celery.
Add spices, lentils, chickpeas, tomatoes, and broth.
Simmer until thick.
Finish with lemon and cilantro.
Serve warm.
